result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerrad John Richard Farr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DE must submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.
Contraband in 16CM45 and 16CM49 to be destroyed after appeal time has expired
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Jail term is with huber and may be served in any county.  DE may participate in jail programing.
Consecutive to: to 16CM3 and any other sentence in being.

records.addlTxt:
10:31 am - DA calls cases 16CM3 and 16CM48 and states appearances.  Defendant Jerrad John Richard Farr appeared with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty (both) by video conference from Ashland County jail.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties acknowledge receipt of revocation packet.  DA certifies victims right compliance.  Recommendations by DA.  Argument by Atty Rafferty.  Comments by DE.  Court imposes:

16CM3 - 4.5 months jail with huber and may be served in any county, consecutive to 16CM48 and any other sentence in being with 69 days credit.  DE may participate in jail programing
Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for payments made. 30 days to pay from date of release or CO.

16CM48 - 4 months jail with huber and may be served in any county, consecutive to 16CM3 and any other sentence in being with 68 days credit.  DE may participate in jail programing
Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for payments made.  30 days to pay from date of release or CO.

Appeal rights given
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 15, 2017 at 10:30 am.
E notice of status change not mailed to Atty. Lex because Atty. Lex was taken off case.
Adjustment Number: 17A 000423, Payable Number: 48487, Receipt Number: 17R 001376, Amount: $20.00
E-filing notice not mailed to Atty. Lex as, Atty. Lex was taken off as DE Atty.
DNA Submission Form

1:15 am - DA calls cases 16CM45, 16CM48, 16CM49 and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Jerrad John Richard Farr appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   This was set for a motion hearing, but instead is a plea and sentencing.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to 16CM48.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on 16CM48 and on motion of DA, dismisses 16CM45 and 16CM49.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO.  Court imposes:

16CM48 - Sentence withheld - 1 year probation
Conditions of probation
$350 fine
$200 DNAAS
$140 restitution + 14 = $154 total
AODA and followthrough
DE must submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.

Contraband in 16CM45 and 16CM49 to be destroyed after appeal time has expired.

Appeal rights given
Motion hearing on December 9, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant may not have contact with Patrick Swartz, unless written consent is filed with the Clerk's office or outside business hours with the Price County Sheriff's Dept.

2:11 pm - DA calls cases 16CM45, 16CM48 and 16CM49 and states appearances.  Defendant Jerrad John Richard Farr appeared with attorney James Richard Lex, who appeared by phone.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states facts of case.  DE has a warrant.  Court questions DE regarding as to why he did not complete his obligations.  DE to sign signature bond, increasing it to a $1500 SB.  Take paperwork from clerks office to PRSO for booking.  Return paperwork to clerks office, and at that time court will quash warrant.
Warrant Cancellation Request
two certified copies returned from PRSO 7/22/16

11:45 am - DA calls cases 16CM45, 16CM48 and 16CM49 and states appearances. Attorney James Richard Lex appeared.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states facts of the cases.  Court orders warrant $500 for all three cases plus execution fee with prior conditions.
Status conference on July 12, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Cases 16CM45, 16CM48, 16CM49.  Defendant Jerrad John Richard Farr appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled. One bond for three cases.
